main_definition: A temporary place of residence or gathering, often outdoors, where people stay to engage in activities such as recreation, learning, or survival.

meanings_and_examples.example: During the summer vacation, my family and I went on a week-long trip to a campsite where we enjoyed swimming in the lake and roasting marshmallows by the fire.
The troops set up their base at the military camp, preparing for an operation that would last several weeks.
After being forced to flee their homes due to conflict, thousands of refugees sought shelter in a nearby temporary camp provided by the UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees).
My friends and I rented an RV to travel around, staying at different campsites along our journey.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Camp as a verb (to pitch) or noun (a site where tents are set up)
meanings_and_examples.example: To camp by the lake meant setting up a tent and spending the night under the stars.
My daughter attended a summer camp for kids her age, where she learned various outdoor skills such as hiking, canoeing, and archery.
